common

Interface MetadataStrategy<D extends Directory<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - the type of Directory, i.e. PngDirectory or DirectoryIFD, handled by this strategy
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<D>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IccStrategy<D>, PngMetadataStrategy, TifMetadataStrategy, XmpStrategy<D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PngMetadata, TifMetadata

    public interface MetadataStrategy<D extends Directory<?>>
extends java.lang.Iterable<D>
    This is the base interface to facilitate the strategy design pattern to support various strategies involving the management of image metadata entries.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addDirectory(D directory)
      Adds a metadata directory to the collection.
      default java.util.Date extractDate()
      Scans all available metadata segments and attempts to extract the best available creation/capture date instance, prioritising segments based on a defined hierarchy, for example: EXIF:DateTimeOriginal, XMP:CreateDate, TIFF:DateTime, etc.
      java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
      Returns the byte order, indicating how data values will be interpreted correctly.
      default boolean hasExifData()
      Checks if the strategy contains EXIF metadata.
      boolean hasMetadata()
      Checks if the metadata collection contains any metadata.
      default boolean hasTextualData()
      Checks if the strategy contains textual metadata, for example: PNG tEXt/iTXt chunks etc.
      default boolean hasXmpData()
      Checks if the strategy contains XMP metadata.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the metadata collection is empty.
      boolean removeDirectory(D directory)
      Removes a metadata directory from the collection.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • addDirectory

        void addDirectory(D directory)
        Adds a metadata directory to the collection.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to add

      • removeDirectory

        boolean removeDirectory(D directory)
        Removes a metadata directory from the collection.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to remove
        Returns:
        true if the directory was successfully removed, otherwise false

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the metadata collection is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the collection is empty, otherwise false

      • hasMetadata

        boolean hasMetadata()
        Checks if the metadata collection contains any metadata.
        Returns:
        true if metadata is present, otherwise false

      • getByteOrder

        java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Returns the byte order, indicating how data values will be interpreted correctly.
        Returns:
        either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

      • hasExifData

        default boolean hasExifData()
        Checks if the strategy contains EXIF metadata. Default implementation returns false for strategies that don't support it.
        Returns:
        the true if EXIF metadata is present, otherwise false

      • hasTextualData

        default boolean hasTextualData()
        Checks if the strategy contains textual metadata, for example: PNG tEXt/iTXt chunks etc. Default implementation returns false for strategies that don't support it.
        Returns:
        the true if Textual information is present, otherwise false

      • hasXmpData

        default boolean hasXmpData()
        Checks if the strategy contains XMP metadata. Default implementation returns false for strategies that don't support it.
        Returns:
        the true if XMP metadata is present, otherwise false

      • extractDate

        default java.util.Date extractDate()
        Scans all available metadata segments and attempts to extract the best available creation/capture date instance, prioritising segments based on a defined hierarchy, for example: EXIF:DateTimeOriginal, XMP:CreateDate, TIFF:DateTime, etc.

        This method abstracts the complexity of searching across different formats, such as EXIF, XMP, or Textual chunks within PNG files to provide a single, prioritised date.

        Returns:
        the prioritised date instance, or null if no supported date metadata is found
